channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023070917
item.description:
Report X-2023070917

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking package found on trailer #952851 already damaged wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of decalcifier 1 one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release package did have slotted partitions but no bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition DescribePack: one 1 gallon plastic bottle had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023070914
item.description:
Report X-2023070914

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer # 806531 already wet leaking and damaged. Package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package taken to hazmat cage. Upon inspecting the inner contents there was an inner box that had 2 x 1 liter plastic bottles of Rapicide PA part A, the 1 bottle was leaking from the cap allowing .20 liters to release. There was a corrugated liner to separate the other 2 x 1 liter's plastic bottles of Rapicide Pa part B inside the box. No other absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The 1 x 1 liter plastic bottle of Rapicide PA part A was leaking from the cap allowing .20 liters to release. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The leaking package was placed in a lined red tote to contain the leaking package, then taken to the hazmat cage for further inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023070897
item.description:
Report X-2023070897

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the damaged hazmat in a black bin on the J-Loop of Bank 1. Grabbed my PPE and put them on to bring back the damaged hazmat to QA. DescribePack: There is a big wet spot between one of the flaps of the box and the side of the box on one corner. I see one of the caps was not completely secured on the bottle. Pull both bottles out of the box to compare the liquid level of each one. The bottle with the loose cap liquid level were slightly lower than the other bottle. DurationRel: 22 and MitigateEffect: brought back to QA, replaced the bin with the red hazardous material bin and kept the box upright to prevent more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023070883
item.description:
Report X-2023070883

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-09
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found the hazmat in a bag on a crate on the hazmat pallet in QA. I went to get my PPE and the red hazardous material bin to further inspect the package. DescribePack: I didn't see any wet spots but I noticed there is a different coloration on the box itself like the box was wet and dried up. I was able to find any visible damage to the container except the fact the weight of the contents were different than the weight was recorded on the shipping label. On the shipping label, the weight of the hazmat was 40 lbs. I checked it again after and it was weighted at 20 lbs. DurationRel: 26 and MitigateEffect: I took the hazmat and put it in the proper red bin and kept it upright to prevent any more leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023070865
item.description:
Report X-2023070865

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered to have leaked when the trailer was opened. Most of what leaked had already evaporated, and the small amount still there was cleaned up with absorbent pads DescribePack: Due to other packages falling on the Hazmat, the cap and pressure vent were blown off the container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The release was primarily evaporated at the time of discovery. area was fanned out and what remained was absorbed with pads.

item.title: Report E-2023070578
item.description:
Report E-2023070578

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: HARRISBURG
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PITT OHIO GROUND LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Upon arrival at the destination terminal, this container was discovered to have been punctured at some point during the loading of the material or during transit. There was a small hole in the side of the drum roughly an inch from the top. The released material was neutralized and collecting with absorbent material. The damaged drums was placed into an overpack for disposition from shipper. The UN spec identification information was not able to be safely obtained once inside the overpack.

item.title: Report E-2023070528
item.description:
Report E-2023070528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading drum from trailer with a drum clamp forklift attachment, the drum was not lifted high enough that when the forklift driver was backing over the dockplate the bottom of the drum hit the lip of the dockplate slighting cutting it contributing to the unintentional release, Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and the drum was repaied with drum putty and placed into a recovery container.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one metal 55 gallon drum of beckosol 12-079 (un1866) had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
